I am impressed! What a trooper you are, and that you are in a way assisting to get closure! I was thinking last night about this coed at Chapel Hil here in my state of NC, as he was shot in the head in a street , and they have no witnesses.  Her name is Eve Carlson.  If we can perfect this tool, and as you said have the documents to back up what messages you get, think of how many people can be helped.  So I assume the police you work with have not pushed you away as a nut job, and are quite happy to receive what you have to help them.  That is great.  
   
  In helping children that may still be alive, there has to be spirits out there that know they are alive and where they are.  I wonder if on the other side there is a command center or group just like this group, working to set up a working link where they can assist. Heck, if I was dead, Id join that group and link up with folks like you.  
   
  You are a wonderful person and thanks for sharing..
   
  If I get anything related to a case, I will send it to you.  
   
  Mike Edwards Cary NC

juli velazquez <ghostchasingfool@...> wrote:
            its not before LC, unfornately it is after they have gone missing or there is a wrongful death attached to their autospy report.  We have been able to get names of people who were named by the box and backed by police accounts.  This has allowed them to take a another look at the statements and requestion those to involved.  It's very little but, but has provided additional lines of questioning for authorities to pursue.
   
  Juli

LC Duplatt <lcdupla@...> wrote:
      Wow, Juli! I never thought of boxes being used this way, especially 
to try and find missing and abducted children/people, etc, BEFORE 
they are harmed. What a great idea to discreetly work with law 
enforcement behind the scenes to see if it is viable. ;)

LC

--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, juli velazquez <ghostchasingfool@...> 
wrote:
>
> Mike,
> I am an advocate for missing children. I actually 
have been testing all of the boxes out regarding this, backed up with 
factual data. I can tell you the results are amazing. 
> 
> I would be more than happy to speak with you regarding 
this off the board and share some of my clips if your interested.
> 
> I will tell you, that the box will never be able to be 
used to prove a death or land a conviction, just like you can not 
have a psychic testify in a court of law. However, if something 
concrete is received in a message or response, and does in fact 
coincide with the coroner's inquest, autopsy reports and/or police 
reports I have in the past, noted the audio and documented it. If it 
could at lease point us in a direction where creditable evidence 
could be gathered that could solve the case, or lead investigators 
down the right path to bring the remains of the missing home, then 
this could be a amazing thing.
> 
> Right now as it stands, it is being look at as an 
additional resource from a psychics perspective and noted just the 
same. Box communication for this purpose is so new, and most of time 
if you do not have access to the formal reports to back up the 
responses, then you can not verify the messages from the other side 
nor can you actually trust that the information you are receiving is 
truth.
> 
> This is a very sensitive subject, and you would never 
want to mislead the families as well as law enforcement on a wild 
goose chase building up hope in the eyes of families who are will do 
just about anything to find answers and bring closure to grieve.
> 
> I only work with law enforcement in what I do, and 
very rarely do I ever work with the family. If I have information 
regarding a case, I will submit it to the authorities and only then 
if something I provide strikes a cord to a case, it is up to them to 
contact me for further information.
> 
> I hope this answers some of your questions, for it 
seems we all have a common goal of utilizing our communication for 
the greater good.
> 
> Juli
> 
> Michael Edwards <f1cracker75@...> wrote:
> As most of you know, I am about two weeks old now in 
this group, and I love it! Very happy to be a part of this team of 
people with like minded interests.
> 
> Have any of you used the Ghost boxes to assist with law 
enforcement agencies, and if so, how have they responded to any 
evidence you may have gathered from our spirit friends. 
> 
> I know psychics are already working with police agencies now 
around the world, but the Ghost box is a whole different method.
> 
> I know the media would have a field day with this, but I would be 
interested if any of you have received messages that have assisted 
the police in solving a crime. 
> 
> Mike Edwards Cary, NC
